title: Thinking Fast and Slow - author's strategies

content.prompt: Which of the following strategies does the author employ in the fifth paragraph?

choices.label: He uses a colon to emphasize the significance of "the one question" that an economist would find "relevant."
He cites the chief investment officer to demonstrate the enthusiasm with which an informed expert forms an opinion.
He repeats "he liked" in a series to show his own support of the chief investment officer's decision.
He contrasts "what we know" and what "he did not know" to suggest that anyone could be an investor.

skill.text: Skill 7.C: Explain how grammar and mechanics contribute to the clarity and effectiveness of an argument.
